Title:
Phlebiporia bubalina gen. et. sp. nov. (Meruliaceae,
Polyporales) from Southwest China with a preliminary phylogeny based on
rDNA sequences
Keywords:
Meruliaceae, phylogeny, polypore, taxonomy,
wood-inhabiting fungi
Abstract:
A new genus, Phlebiporia, is proposed based on
morphological characters and molecular data. It is typified by P.
bubalina sp. nov., and the new species is characterized by an annual
growth habit, resupinate basidiocarps, a monomitic hyphal system with
simple septa, dextrinoid and thick-walled generative hyphae, presence of
abundant thin-walled dendrohyphidia in the subiculum, and small, smooth,
ellipsoid basidiospores. Phylogenetic analysis of P. bubalina and its
related species was inferred from ITS and nLSU rDNA sequences, which
indicates that it belongs to the Meruliaceae.
